p: Virions of bromovirids are non-enveloped, being either spherical or pseudo-spherical, with T = 3 icosahedral symmetries, and a diameter of 26–35 nm (genera Anulavirus, Bromovirus, Cucumovirus and Ilarvirus), whereas genera Alfamovirus and some ilarviruses have bacilliform virions, of diameters 18–26 nm and lengths of 30–85 nm. In Oleavirus virions have different shape.
